documentation.dc:title: Minimal Economy with a Labor, Food and Utility Market
documentation.dc:subject: Agent-based computational economics
documentation.dc:creator: Lars Langjahr

MessageType.name: StartOfDay_Notification
MessageType.documentation: A message of the market to announce the trading price of the last day

MessageType.name: Act_msg
MessageType.documentation: A message to an EconomicAgent, which signals them to being with their work.

MessageType.name: ClearMarket
MessageType.documentation: A message to a Market, which ends the trading day.

MessageType.name: BL4Offer
MessageType.documentation: A list of oofers to the market, made by a BL4Agent.

MessageType.name: MatchingOffer
MessageType.documentation: A successful trade returned from the market

ExogenousEventType.name: Init
ExogenousEventType.documentation: Triggers certain EnvironmentRule, needed for the initialization

ExogenousEventType.name: StartOfDay
ExogenousEventType.documentation: Starts a new day. EnvironmentRules are triggered, which check if a person has enough food, a firm is bankrupt and send the marketprices of the last day is announced to all EconomicAgents.

ExogenousEventType.name: StartWork
ExogenousEventType.documentation: Triggers the StartWork_ER-EnvironmentRule, which tells the EconomicAgents to start with their work.

ExogenousEventType.name: CloseMarket
ExogenousEventType.documentation: Ends the day, by triggering the CloseMarket_ER-EnvironmentRule. Which tells the Markets to end the trading day and calculate a new market price.

AgentType.name: EconomicAgent
AgentType.documentation:
Superclass of Person and Firm, which has the basic functionality for communicating with the market(price updates and succesfull transactions). Further it adds help functions to find a specific asset or to create an offer.
LABOR_ALLOWANCE: The amount of labor, a laborer offers every day. lastFoodPrice, lastLaborPrice, lastUtilityPrice: The trading price of the last day.

Function.name: getAssetByName
Function.documentation: Finds an asset from the AssetsList by String.

ReactionRule.name: StartOfDay_Food_Rule
ReactionRule.documentation: The price of the food market is updated.

ReactionRule.name: StartOfDay_Labor_Rule
ReactionRule.documentation: The price of the labor market is updated.

ReactionRule.name: StartOfDay_Utility_Rule
ReactionRule.documentation: The price of the utility market is updated.

ReactionRule.name: Deposit_Money_Rule
ReactionRule.documentation: When a sell transaction was successful, the money amount is increased by the quantity times the price of the offer.

ReactionRule.name: Withdraw_Money_Rule
ReactionRule.documentation: When a buy transaction was successful, the money amount is decreased by the quantity times the of the offer.

ReactionRule.name: Deposit_Food_Rule
ReactionRule.documentation: When a buyFood transaction was successful, the food amount is increased by the quantity of the offer.

ReactionRule.name: Withdraw_Food_Rule
ReactionRule.documentation: When a sellfood transaction was successful, the food amount is decreased by the quantity of the offer.

ReactionRule.name: Deposit_Labor_Rule
ReactionRule.documentation: When a buylabor transaction was successful, the labor amount is increased by the quantity of the offer.

ReactionRule.name: Withdraw_Labor_Rule
ReactionRule.documentation: When a selllabor transaction was successful, the labor amount is decreased by the quantity of the offer.

ReactionRule.name: Deposit_Utility_Rule
ReactionRule.documentation: When a buyutility transaction was successful, the utility amount is increased by the quantity of the offer.

ReactionRule.name: Withdraw_Utility_Rule
ReactionRule.documentation: When a sellutility transaction was successful, the utility amount is decreased by the quantity of the offer.

AgentType.name: Person
AgentType.documentation:
Superclass to represent a BL4Person
EAT_AMOUNT: The amount of food a person eats every day. TARGET_FOOD_STOCK: The aimed food amount. income: Amount of money a person can spend during a day.

documentation.description:
A BL4Person is either a laborer or an owner. Every day he has to consume EAT_AMOUNT units of food or he dies. To earn money, a Laborer sells his labor while a owner uses the money of his firm. Further a person tries to sell spare food. To survive he tries to buys food, from the rest of his money he buys utility. In order that the bidding functions work correct, the BuyFood_Rule has to be executed before the BuyUtility_Rule. This is because, offers are cleared after they are returned from the market, otherwise a person would spend to much money on utility.
TARGET_MONEY_STOCK: The aimed money amount. foodBuyList: Collects all buy offers for food. utilityBuyList: Collects all buy offers for utility. foodSellList: Collects all sell offers for food.

Function.name: buyFood
Function.documentation: Abstract function, specified in BL4Laborer and BL4Owner.
Function.Body: return false;

Function.name: sellFood
Function.documentation: If a person has more than 1.5 * TARGET_FOOD_STOCK units of food, he tries to sell his spare food. A new offer is made for every unit of food. The further this unit is over the target, the lower is the price. All buy offers are added to the foodSellList.

Function.name: buyUtility
Function.documentation: If a person has more food than his TARGET_FOOD_STOCK and more money than his TARGET_MONEY_STOCK, he tries to buy utility. All buy offers are added to the UtilityBuyList.

documentation.description: The person decides how much food wants to buy
The person decides how much food wants to sell
The person decides how much utility wants to buy

AgentType.name: BL4Laborer
AgentType.documentation:
A Laborer is a Person, who tries to sell his labor.
laborSellList: Collects all sell offers for labor.

Function.name: buyFood
Function.documentation: Creates buy offers for food until the limit of 1.5 times TARGET_FOOD_STOCK is reached. A new offer is made for every unit of food and the income is reduced by the price. The further this unit is under the TARGET_FOOD_STOCK, the higher is the price. Accordingly the further this unit is over the TARGET_FOOD_STOCK, the lower is the price. All buy offers are added to the FoodBuyList.

Function.name: sellLabor
Function.documentation: If a person has less food than his TARGET_FOOD_STOCK and the LastLaborPrice is higher than the FoodLaborPrice, he needs the food and is willing to work for less than the LastLaborPrice, otherwise the LastLaborPrice is the lastLaborPrice times a random factor. All buy offers are added to the LaborSellList.

documentation.description: The person decides how much labor wants to sell

AgentType.name: BL4Owner
AgentType.documentation:
A Owner is a Person, who lives from the income of his firm.
TARGET_FIRM_MONEY_STOCK: aimed money amount of his firm. firm: the firm owned by the owner, allocated in the Initialize_Ownershil_ER EnvironmentRule.

Function.name: buyFood
Function.documentation: Like the buyFood function of the laborer, except that in the beginning the owner takes spare money from his firm. All buy offers are added to the FoodBuyList.

AgentType.name: BL4Firm
AgentType.documentation:
A BL4Firm is either a farm or a factory. A firm buys labor from the market, converts this labor into a product and sells the product on the market.
amountProduced: The amount a firm has produced in this day. owner: The owner of this firm. buyList: Collects all buy offers for labor. sellList: Collects all sell offers for this firms product.

Function.name: buyLabor
Function.documentation: Abstract function, specified in BL4Farm and BL4Factory
Function.Body: return false;

documentation.description: The factory decides how much labort it wants to buy

AgentType.name: BL4Farm
AgentType.documentation:
A farm is a firm which produces food.
TARGET_FOOD_STOCK: The aimed food amount of this farm. TARGET_OWNER_FOOD_STOCK: The aimed food amount of the owner.

Function.name: sellFood
Function.documentation: When a farm has produced food at this day, it tries to sell all of it. The price is the last market price times a random factor. All sell offers are added to the SellList.

Function.name: buyLabor
Function.documentation: A Farm has two diffrent bidding functions for labor. The first is only used when the food amount of the owner is less than 0.75 times the TARGET_OWNER_FOOD_STOCK and the farm is under its traget. The prices of the first bidding function is always over the market price and depend on the food amount of the owner. While the second is every day. It creates offers, where the prices decrease the closer the expected food amount is to the TARGET_FOOD_STOCK. When the TARGET_FOOD_STOCK is reached or the bidding prices is half of the LastLaborPrice, the farm stops bidding. All buy offers are added to the BuyList.

Function.name: convertToFood
Function.documentation: Calculates how much food could be produced with a specific amount of labor
Function.Body: return (-0.0652 * laborQuantity * laborQuantity) + 4.0652 * laborQuantity;

Function.name: produceFood
Function.documentation: Converts all labor to food

documentation.description: The farm decides how much food it wants to sell

AgentType.name: BL4Factory
AgentType.documentation:
A factory is a firm which produces utility.
TARGET_UTILITY_STOCK: The aimed utility amount of this farm.

Function.name: sellUtility
Function.documentation: When a factory has produced utility at this day, it tries to sell all of it. The price is the last market price times a random factor. All sell offers are added to the SellList.

Function.name: buyLabor
Function.documentation: Creates offers, where the prices decrease the closer the expected utility amount is to the TARGET_UTILITY_STOCK. When the TARGET_UTILITY_STOCK is reached or the bidding prices is half of the LastLaborPrice, the factory stops bidding. All buy offers are added to the BuyList

Function.name: convertToUtility
Function.documentation: Calculates how much utility could be produced with a specific amount of labor
Function.Body: return ((Double)(((-0.0652 * laborQuantity * laborQuantity) + 4.0652 * laborQuantity) / 2.0)).longValue();

Function.name: produceUtility
Function.documentation: converts all labor to utility

documentation.description: The factory decides how much utility it wants to sell

AgentType.name: Market
AgentType.documentation: Collects offers made by Firms and Persons and tries to match buy and sell offers.

Function.name: clear
Function.documentation: abstract function

ReactionRule.name: Return_TradeOffers
ReactionRule.documentation: Done trades are returned to the persons and firms

AgentType.name: BL4Market
AgentType.documentation: The baseline4 implementation of a market

Function.name: clear
Function.documentation: Calculates the market price and adds the corresponding buy- and selloffers to the transactionlist

Function.name: equal
Function.documentation: Check if the two Inputparameters are equal

Function.name: less
Function.documentation: checks if a less b
Function.Body: return (a + 1e-5 < b);

AgentType.name: BL4ContinuousCommodityMarket
AgentType.documentation: The baseline4 market for continuous commodities

AgentType.name: BL4DiscreteCommodityMarket
AgentType.documentation: The baseline4 market for discrete commodities

EnvironmentRule.name: Initialize_Ownership_ER
EnvironmentRule.documentation: Finds an owner for every firm(BL4 only)

EnvironmentRule.name: AtStartOfDayEat_ER
EnvironmentRule.documentation: Every person tries to eat, if he can't then he dies

EnvironmentRule.name: CheckBankrupt_ER
EnvironmentRule.documentation: If a farm has no more money, food and labor or a factory has no more money, utility and labor , it is shut down(BL4 only)

EnvironmentRule.name: StartOfDay_Rule_ER
EnvironmentRule.documentation: For all markets that exist, the market price of the last day is send to every person and firm

EnvironmentRule.name: StartWork_ER
EnvironmentRule.documentation: Act_msg is sent to every person and firm, which signals them to being with their work.

EnvironmentRule.name: CloseMarket_ER
EnvironmentRule.documentation: ClearMarket is send to every market, which ends the trading day.

new js.util.ArrayList(new aors.util.economics.ContinuousQuantity(20.0, new aors.util.economics.ContinuousQuantityType("Food", "Stk")), new aors.util.economics.ContinuousQuantity(100.0, new aors.util.economics.ContinuousQuantityType("Money", "Stk")), new aors.util.economics.ContinuousQuantity(0.0, new aors.util.economics.ContinuousQuantityType("Labor", "Stk")), new aors.util.economics.DiscreteQuantity("Utility", 0))

new js.util.ArrayList(new aors.util.economics.ContinuousQuantity(0.0, new aors.util.economics.ContinuousQuantityType("Food", "Stk")), new aors.util.economics.ContinuousQuantity(100.0, new aors.util.economics.ContinuousQuantityType("Money", "Stk")), new aors.util.economics.ContinuousQuantity(0.0, new aors.util.economics.ContinuousQuantityType("Labor", "Stk")), new aors.util.economics.DiscreteQuantity("Utility", 5))
